channel.title: Server Advertisements Board
channel.description:
As much attention as the Server Advertisement board gets I believe there should be child boards something like
-Server Advertisements --194-474 --474-562 --598-700+
The reasoning for this is two reasons:
1) would make it easier for people to navigate servers that they actually want to play 2) Organization
Other thoughts: Personally I don't play 474-562 and I was kind of hesitant of making a 3rd child board there but people like Ash do originate from those types so thought it would be a good addition just in case.
Maybe instead of 194-317 it should be like 194-498 and then 508-634?

item.title: Server Advertisements Board
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:19, topic:534820”]So, you try to get this split, when we couldn’t even get the server help section split( the section with WAY MORE TOPICS in there, let alone the ones in the wrong section)?
Sorry but until that happens, I won’t think to support this. (since I know that won’t happen as is).[/quote]not really the same.

server help aspect it’s all java but different naming/structure.
if you know the basics of the server you work with, people can use broad terms. “combat handling class, item handling class, click item packet” etc

advertising on the other hand, would actually be split up by revision due to that being a main focal point of the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisements Board
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

So, you try to get this split, when we couldn’t even get the server help section split( the section with WAY MORE TOPICS in there, let alone the ones in the wrong section)?
Sorry but until that happens, I won’t think to support this. (since I know that won’t happen as is).

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisements Board
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:534820”][quote author=Newty link=topic=653618.msg4381680#msg4381680 date=1383766350]
Why does everyone always want more boards?
[/quote]its like their drug

their high from the last boards is wearing off, they need another hit[/quote]hey man don’t mess with me! I gotta have my board!

But no seriously I do agree with Flame the prefix tags would be a good addition. The issue is that a lot of times you just can’t tell what is what with all the revisions being pushed in the same category.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisements Board
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Why does everyone always want more boards?

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisements Board
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

I don’t think creating more boards for the sake of organisation is a good idea. Sure, it’ll help users searching for a server, however it is easier for thread creators to add a prefix in their title like [317], [474], etc. I’m sure a mod could potentially be added to accommodate this when the forum upgrades even.

All in all, there’s no point in watering down the board for the sake of organisation, it creates more moderation which can be avoided through different methods.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisements Board
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:2, topic:534820”]So give the mods more work? If people cannot even post in the correct section to begin with do you think they will know which revision to post their server under?[/quote]I think the mods should give their input on whether they want to moderate this or not.

We don’t have that many server advertisements, it would really separate this forum even more.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisements Board
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Splitting boards is bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisements Board
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:8, topic:534820”]I personally disagree with the thought. It would demand more time from me and other moderators, and it isn’t worth the time having to constantly move topics around this way.

After giving some thought to the idea, I came up with an alternative. Give the option for all major server revisions to have tags, such as #317, #377, #474, #508, etc. and have anchor links on the top of the advertisment board. Clicking on, say, a #317 would bring you to all servers listed under the #317 tag.[/quote]#317 #474 #498 #508 #525 #530 #666 #742 #project-insanity

Read full topic

After giving some thought to the idea, I came up with an alternative. Give the option for all major server revisions to have tags, such as #317, #377, #474, #508, etc. and have anchor links on the top of the advertisment board. Clicking on, say, a #317 would bring you to all servers listed under the #317 tag.[/quote]sounds like a great alternative

item.title: Server Advertisements Board
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:9, topic:534820”][quote author=Flame_ link=topic=653618.msg4379242#msg4379242 date=1383008397]
I personally disagree with the thought. It would demand more time from me and other moderators, and it isn’t worth the time having to constantly move topics around this way.

After giving some thought to the idea, I came up with an alternative. Give the option for all major server revisions to have tags, such as #317, #377, #474, #508, etc. and have anchor links on the top of the advertisment board. Clicking on, say, a #317 would bring you to all servers listed under the #317 tag.
[/quote]

Not sure if smf has prefixing by default, if not it would need to be installed with a package, which presents another problem. The forum is still under the updating,[/quote]
Classic MoparScape

Read full topic

item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

I personally disagree with the thought. It would demand more time from me and other moderators, and it isn’t worth the time having to constantly move topics around this way.

After giving some thought to the idea, I came up with an alternative. Give the option for all major server revisions to have tags, such as #317, #377, #474, #508, etc. and have anchor links on the top of the advertisment board. Clicking on, say, a #317 would bring you to all servers listed under the #317 tag.

So give the mods more work? If people cannot even post in the correct section to begin with do you think they will know which revision to post their server under?
[/quote]
Sorry bby. I have to agree with this.

Kids now-a-days think their 317 is a 525 or 562[/quote]
You don’t know how correct you are.

item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“nolan2131, post:4, topic:534820”]If they were going to do that wouldn’t it make sense to categorize all revisions throughout the forum sections? Downloads, development, etc…[/quote]One step at a time

I was just suggesting advertisements specifically due to I know Flame_ does an excellent job at his board (not to say the other sectionals don’t as they do a good job as well )

Read full topic

item.title: Server Advertisements Board

item.title: Server Advertisements Board
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:2, topic:534820”]So give the mods more work? If people cannot even post in the correct section to begin with do you think they will know which revision to post their server under?[/quote]Flame already does an excellent job I don’t think it would be too much more work. You can always close the main server advertisement board so it can’t be used or for that matter if a person isn’t sure they can always post it on the main board to be moved. I also don’t think you are giving even the leechers enough credit. NORMALLY when they download a 718 vs. a 317 they at least know that cause that’s what they searched for.

Don’t get me wrong I want to make the volunteer moderators have as much free time as possible but it can be difficult sometimes to navigate the board.

Edit: also if a person spams a board with an advertisement they are going to get some form of disciplinary action anyway.I would assume the same would happen to people who make multiple accounts for “new” servers and constantly post in the incorrect section ~^

Read full topic
